intro: Ferocactus alamosanus subsp. alamosanus, commonly known as the Alamos canyon cholla, is a species of cactus native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are covered in clusters of spines, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are pollinated by various insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its slow growth rate, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in dry gardens.
